attributes.action: Abolish the right of MP's to have a funded second home
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To abolish the automatic right to a second home where profit can be made. To replace this where an MP lives outside 1 hours commuting distance from a mainline Rail or Tube Station with a home to be purchased and furnished by the state to the average standard of the MPs constituents so as to ground MP's in the real world. 
Those MP's living closer than 1 hour from a mainline rail or tube station to live in their constituencey home.
The home to be purchased by the state for the duration of the MP's term of office, and at the end of that term, to sell the building and contents returning the proceeds to the public purse.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
